original_title: Sri Lanka’s showcase culinary competition to attract over 450 local chefs
original_body_lines: Kandy is set to host a grand culinary showcase, bringing together talented chefs from across Sri Lanka for a one-of-a-kind competition. This year’s event marks the second edition of this culinary championship, with the promise of fresh talent, local ingredients and innovative recipes taking center stage.
The event, to be held at Sahas Uyana on October 31 and on November 1 and 2, will showcase the skills and creativity of both seasoned professionals and rising stars of the Sri Lankan culinary scene.

Organized by Lanka Exhibition and Conference Services (Pvt) Ltd the event will be supported by the Kandy Hoteliers Association, Nuwara Eliya Hoteliers Association and Cultural Triangle Hoteliers Association.

Speaking at a press briefing held recently at the Hilton Colombo Residences, Kandy Hoteliers Association president Rodney Armstrong said: ‘I was judging events here for all the local events. So, I have been quite involved. I am in Sri Lanka now 23 years.’

Armstrong added: ‘We have been providing a pretty good setup, kitchen-wise. We have some judges who are confident in what they’re doing. And we feel that this will be a great reflection on the culinary capacity of the chefs.

‘Of course, I believe all of our competitors are Sri Lankan. But we hope that they will all have a good opportunity to portray their skills. As in the past, I think we have always invited the top chefs overseas.
‘It’s to give the chefs an opportunity to own their skills in front of judges. To win awards. To win medals.

‘What we’re looking for in this competition is not just a dish that appeals to the judges but one that would delight any guest. After all, it’s the guests who ultimately enjoy the creativity and quality of the food.

‘Over the course of three days, nearly 460 competitors will be vying for medals and recognition. This is no small feat and to accommodate the participants and judges, many of whom are coming from abroad, the organizers have pulled out all the stops.’
“These interactions and the sharing of knowledge that happen here are invaluable for any chef, said Husnie Rauf, Chief Operating Officer, Lanka Exhibition and Conference Services (Pvt) Ltd.
He added: “It’s a chance to learn new techniques, get inspired by others, and bring that learning back to their kitchens.”

“The event showcases the dedication of sponsors, many of whom are excited to see their products used in innovative ways. This collaboration not only benefits the tourism and hospitality industry but also supports local industries and suppliers who provide the competition’s core ingredients.”
Unilever Lanka Consumer Limited Junior Customer Strategic and Planning Manager Andrea Fonseka said:

“So when talking about our objective in this: it’s not just making a dish, it is about giving an experience to the audience, an amazing experience for their life. So we believe that investing in something like that, this would be a greater opportunity. Being a part of Unilever Food Solutions, which is the food service business for Unilever Sri Lanka, we are a trusted partner for the hotel industry, the food solutions; the food services industry in Sri Lanka.

“There are four main awards that we will be giving out in this competition, along with a few other categories. And we would like to thank all the other sponsors who have also joined, joining your helping hand to make this event a success. So our objective and our belief is that this will be continued for years so that as a growing business in the Sri Lankan culinary industry, we believe that this would be a golden opportunity for us as well.”
